last_episode_to_air.name: To Sirloin with Love
last_episode_to_air.overview: Thankful to finally have something in common with his son, Hank is proud when Bobbyâ€™s knowledge of beef earns him a spot on a college team bound for the State Championships.

name: King of the Hill
overview: Set in Texas, this animated series follows the life of propane salesman Hank Hill, who lives with his overly confident substitute Spanish teacher wife Peggy, wannabe comedian son Bobby, and naive niece Luanne. Hank has conservative views about God, family, and country, but his values and ethics are often challenged by the situations he, his family, and his beer-drinking neighbors/buddies find themselves in.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: Middle-class Texan Hank Hill blows his top when an overzealous social worker accuses him of child abuse after rumors about his son's black eye get out of hand.

episodes.name: Square Peg
episodes.overview: Hank is annoyed when Bobby asks to take a sex-education class--especially when he discovers that Peggy's the teacher.

episodes.name: The Order of the Straight Arrow
episodes.overview: A camping trip with Bobby's scout troop leaves Hank griping after the boy clubs an endangered bird during a faux hunt. Meanwhile, Peggy embarks on a mysterious quest.

episodes.name: Hank's Got the Willies
episodes.overview: Hank's determination to find a role model for Bobby leads to an unexpected encounter with Hank's own hero.

episodes.name: Luanne's Saga
episodes.overview: When Luanne breaks up with Buckley, Hank takes it upon himself to pick up the pieces of his niece's broken heart, only to be left fuming when she makes a play for Boomhauer.

episodes.name: Hank's Unmentionable Problem
episodes.overview: A concerned Peggy inadvertently spreads the word about Hank's bout with constipation, leaving her husband flushed with embarrassment.

episodes.name: Westie Side Story
episodes.overview: The Hills' new Laotian neighbors cause Peggy and Hank confusion and consternation after a culture clash leads to suspicion over a missing dog.

episodes.name: Shins of the Father
episodes.overview: Hank's caught in the middle when his overbearing father pays a visit--and incurs the wrath of a patience-exhausted Peggy.

episodes.name: Peggy the Boggle Champ
episodes.overview: Peggy's skill with words wins her the privilege of representing Arlen in the state Boggle championship.

episodes.name: Keeping Up With Our Joneses
episodes.overview: Hank and Peggy's love of cigarettes is rekindled after Hank catches Bobby smoking, but Luanne is determined to nip their habit in the butt.

episodes.name: King of the Ant Hill
episodes.overview: Hank's burning mad when he discovers fire ants on his lawn on the eve of the neighborhood block party.

episodes.name: Plastic White Female
episodes.overview: Luanne and Bobby each face a crisis: she's fearful of failing her beauty exam, while he frets over his first boy-girl party.

episodes.name: How to Fire a Rifle Without Really Trying
episodes.overview: Bobby discovers a talent for target shooting, Hank thinks this could be his chance to bond with his son.  The only problem is that Hank can't shoot.  Ashamed to admit that he can't use a gun properly, Hank refuses to enter the father-son fun-shoot with Bobby.

episodes.name: Texas City Twister
episodes.overview: When Hank discovers that the trailer Luanne grew up in is still available, he wants Luanne to move out of the house and back into the trailer.  Hank and Peggy have a fight where Peggy accuses Hank of being cold and repressed, and Hank sort of tells Peggy to go to hell.  After Peggy goes with Luanne to help her move, Hank learns that a tornado is heading for the trailer park.  It's up to him to save his wife and niece, and to prove that he's not so repressed after all.

episodes.name: The Arrowhead
episodes.overview: After Hank finds a couple of Native American artifacts in his yard, a snobbish archaeology professor from Arlen University gets Peggy's permission to dig there.  Peggy is fascinated by the professor's sophistication and knowledge, and Hank becomes jealous.

episodes.name: Hilloween
episodes.overview: Junie Harper, a conservative church member, declares that Halloween is a Satanic holiday, and gets the school to shut down Hank's "Haunted House" on the grounds that it violates the separation of church and state.  Luanne and even Bobby start to believe Junie when she says that Hank is a Satanist, and Hank has to fight against Junie's attempt to cancel Halloween for the whole town.

episodes.name: Jumpin' Crack Bass (it's A Gas, Gas, Gas)
episodes.overview: Hank can't catch any fish with hand-dug American Earthworms, so he decides to try some artificial bait.  Unfortunately, he mistakenly buys crack cocaine, thinking that it's fishing bait -- and the fish become addicted to his new bait. Hank gets in trouble with the law when he goes back to the dealer to buy some stronger bait.

episodes.name: Husky Bobby
episodes.overview: Bobby becomes a successful model for overweight boys' clothes.  Peggy is happy that Bobby is feeling good about himself.  But Hank is worried that Bobby will get picked on.

episodes.name: The Man Who Shot Cane Skretteburg
episodes.overview: When Hank and his friends get trounced by four teenagers in a game of paintball, they fear that they're growing old.  They decide that to beat the teenagers in a rematch.  They'll have to learn to understand the mind of a teenager, while defending their OWN egos in the process.

episodes.name: The Son That Got Away
episodes.overview: Hank and Kahn fear the worst when Bobby, Connie, and Joseph explore a cave where teenagers go to make out. The whole clan reveals their experiences with The Boneyard, as the search for the trio ensues.  The most unlikely of heroes comes through, to 'rescue' the kids and save the day.

episodes.name: The Company Man
episodes.overview: Hank tries to get the propane account with Mr. Holloway, a visiting businessman from Boston.  Holloway has stereotypical ideas about Texas and is disappointed that Hank doesn't live up to the stereotype.  So Hank must swallow his pride and act like a "cowboy" to get the account.  All the while, competing with his biggest rival, Thatherton...who has NO PROBLEM playing the part to win the account.

episodes.name: Bobby Slam
episodes.overview: Bobby joins the wrestling team at Tom Landry Middle School.  When Connie decides that she, too, wants to wrestle, Peggy uses Title IX of the Civil Rights Act to force the coach to give her a tryout.  But the coach gets his revenge by pitting Connie against Bobby in a wrestling match.  Bobby and Connie devise a little plan of their own to outsmart the coach's decisions.

episodes.name: The Unbearable Blindness of Laying
episodes.overview: Hank's mother comes to visit for Christmas with her new boyfriend, Garry.  When Hank walks in on his mother and Garry having sex, he goes blind. Garry figures out the problem, and tries to help regain his sight, and they end up at a Faith Healing Church for answers.

episodes.name: Meet the Manger Babies
episodes.overview: After seeing that Luanne is depressed, Hank volunteers to buy her some hand puppets at a rummage sale. Luanne starts doing a Christian puppet show, The Manger Babies.  Hank agrees to play God in the televised version of the puppet show.  When it turns out that the show will be on at the same time as the Super Bowl, Hank has to choose between helping Luanne or watching the game.

episodes.name: Snow Job
episodes.overview: When Hank's boss, Buck Strickland, has another heart attack, Hank expects to be put in charge of the company while Buck is recuperating.  Instead Buck picks Lloyd Vickers, a business-school graduate, and puts Hank in charge of feeding his dogs.  At Buck's house, Hank discovers that Buck's stove is electric, not propane.  Realizing that Buck is just in propane for the money, Hank considers leaving the propane business and opening up a general store instead.

episodes.name: I Remember Mono
episodes.overview: On Valentine's Day, Peggy finds out that Hank lied to her when they were dating: he told her he was at home one week with a football injury, when he actually got mono from kissing another girl. She sets out to uncover the whole truth, and finds herself face to face with the past.

episodes.name: Three Days of the Kahndo
episodes.overview: Hank and his family go with Kahn and his family to spend a weekend in a duplex condo in Mexico.  When Kahn discovers that only the bottom half of the condo has been rented, he breaks into the top half and lets Hank stay there.  Dale shows up to stay with the Hills, and when Hank, Kahn and Dale are arrested for breaking into the upstairs condo, they have to sneak back across the border.

episodes.name: Traffic Jam
episodes.overview: After Hank has a car accident, he has to go to traffic school.  The teacher of the traffic school is a comedian, Booda Sack, who gets laughs by insulting the audience.  Inspired by Booda Sack, Bobby tries developing a stand-up act of his own.  Booda Sack tells Bobby that to be funny, he needs to get in touch with his roots as a white man.  Looking for something about "white roots" on the internet, Bobby comes across all the material he needs on a site called the White Nationalist Brotherhood.

episodes.name: Hank's Dirty Laundry
episodes.overview:
When Hank tries to buy a new dryer, he is told that his credit is no good because he owes money to Arlen Video.  The video store's computer says he rented and never returned a pornographic movie, Cuffs and Collars.

Hank refuses to pay for a movie he never rented, and sets out to prove that the computer was wrong.

episodes.name: The Final Shinsult
episodes.overview: When Cotton learns that the U.S. government is giving the artificial leg of General Santa Ana back to Mexico, he teams up with Dale to steal the leg from the Arlen Museum.

episodes.name: Leanne's Saga
episodes.overview: When Luanne's mother, Leanne, is released from prison, she starts living in the Hills' garage, and becomes romantically involved with Bill.  Bill is busy fighting a foot fungus, with every last dime.

episodes.name: Junkie Business
episodes.overview: After Hank realizes that his new employee at Strickland Propane is a drug addict, he can't fire him, because drug addiction counts as a disability under the Americans With Disabilities Act.

episodes.name: Life in the Fast Lane: Bobby's Saga
episodes.overview: To teach his son the value of a dollar, Hank makes Bobby get a job selling drinks at the racetrack, and tells Bobby to do everything his boss says.  What Hank doesn't know is that Bobby's boss, Jimmy Witchard, is a complete moron who makes Bobby do humiliating and even dangerous tasks.  Meanwhile, Boomhauer competes for the right to drive the pace car in the NASCAR race.

episodes.name: Peggy's Turtle Song
episodes.overview: After Bobby eats too much sugar one morning, he is mistakenly diagnosed with attention deficit disorder.  Feeling guilty about not spending enough time with her son, Peggy decides to give up teaching and be a stay-at-home mother, a decision Hank fully approves of.  But Peggy is so bored at home that she starts taking guitar lessons, and composes a symbolic song about a turtle trapped in her shell.  Meanwhile, Bobby takes pills for his ADD, and Luanne becomes convinced that she caught ADD from Bobby.

episodes.name: Propane Boom
episodes.overview: When Mega Lo Mart starts selling propane, Strickland Propane can't compete with their prices, and Hank loses his job. He winds up working in the propane department at Mega Lo Mart, under the supervision of Luanne's boyfriend Buckley. Hank and other Mega Lo Mart employees decide to protest the way the company destroys small businesses, by disrupting a concert by the company spokesman, Chuck Mangione. Meanwhile, Luanne, who wanted Buckley to give her the job that he gave to Hank, tells Buckley she's breaking up with him. And Hank, Luanne and Buckley are the only people in the Mega Lo Mart when Hank notices a leak...

episodes.name: Death of a Propane Salesman
episodes.overview: Hank and Luanne survive the Mega Lo Mart explosion, but Buckley is no more. Hank finds that he is scared of propane, and tries to figure out how to deal with his fear of dying. Meanwhile, Luanne, who lost all her hair in the explosion, decides to become an activist like Sinead O'Connor.

episodes.name: And They Call It Bobby Love
episodes.overview: Bobby starts dating Marie, a girl who's two years older than him. Bobby takes the relationship more seriously than Marie does, and is heartbroken when she dances with other guys.  Marie decides to "move on" leaving Bobby an emotional wreck.    Meanwhile, Hank and the guys find an abandoned couch in the alley, and grow to depend on it.

episodes.name: Peggy's Headache
episodes.overview: When Peggy starts writing "musings" for the local newspaper, the pressure gives her a headache, so she goes to John Redcorn for a theraputic massage.  When she finds out that Dale's wife Nancy is having an affair with John Redcorn, she is so horrified that she decides to tell Dale about it.

episodes.name: Pregnant Paws
episodes.overview: Hank wants to breed Ladybird, but the veterinarian says that she has a narrow uterus and probably can't have children.  Hank becomes obsessed with finding a way to get Ladybird pregnant, which annoys Peggy, because she's the one who really wants another baby.  Meanwhile, Dale becomes a bounty hunter and is assigned to hunt down a man with several unpaid parking tickets.  He decides that he needs a hound to accompany him on his first bounty, so he nabs Ladybird, to Hank's horror.

episodes.name: Next of Shin
episodes.overview: Hank tries several different methods to improve his sperm count so he can get Peggy pregnant.  The frustration of not being able to have another child becomes worse when Cotton shows up and announces that he got his wife pregnant.  But Cotton becomes so nervous at the prospect of having a baby at his age that he flees to Las Vegas, and Hank, Bill and Dale go after him.

episodes.name: Peggy's Pageant Fever
episodes.overview: A beauty pageant offers Peggy the chance to win a truck.  If she can endure a series of rigorous makeovers to impress the judges.

episodes.name: Nine Pretty Darn Angry Men
episodes.overview: After a Thanksgiving dinner where Cotton constantly insults Hank's mother, Hank, his neighbors, and his father attend a lawn mower focus group.  The company announces that it is retiring its old model and introducing a new, "yuppified" version.  Hank is the only one on the group who defends the old mower -- but is he trying to defend the mower, or his mother?

episodes.name: Good Hill Hunting
episodes.overview: All the kids in the neighborhood are going on their first hunt, but Hank is unable to get a hunting license for him and Bobby.  Bobby is so upset about being denied the chance at a rite of passage that he starts to regress into acting like a little kid.  Hank reluctantly decides to take Bobby hunting at the La Grunta Resort.

episodes.name: Pretty, Pretty Dresses
episodes.overview: At Christmastime, Bill becomes even more depressed than usual, because it's the anniversary of when his wife Lenore left him.  Bill tries to commit suicide, and when that doesn't work out, he dresses up in Lenore's old clothes and declares that he is Lenore.

episodes.name: A Firefighting We Will Go
episodes.overview: Hank and his friends become volunteer firefighters.  They manage to wreck a fire hydrant, ruin a funeral, and finally burn down the Arlen firehouse.  When the Fire Captain comes to ask what happened, the trio turns the story around to match each of their scenarios.

episodes.name: To Spank, with Love
episodes.overview: After being taunted and pantsed by one of her students, Peggy loses it and spanks him.  She is immediately fired, but Cotton and his old buddies start a campaign to get "Paddlin' Peggy" reinstated.   Once she is back teaching, Peggy uses her reputation for violence to scare her students, and takes things too far, in true Peggy fashion.

episodes.name: Three Coaches and a Bobby
episodes.overview: Hank gets his tough old football coach to lead Bobby's football team.  When the coach proves to be a tyrant, Bobby decides to quit football and join the soccer team, much to Hank's disappointment.  Meanwhile, Peggy tries to fit in with the other soccer moms, and takes a crash course from Minh on Soccer-mom etiquette.

episodes.name: De-Kahnstructing Henry
episodes.overview: Kahn gets a great new job and invites Hank over to the office, hoping to make him jealous.  While bragging about his job, Kahn gives away government secrets, swearing Hank to secrecy.  Hank talks to Bill about Kahn's job, and Kahn gets fired for it.

episodes.name: The Wedding of Bobby Hill
episodes.overview: Bobby lets Luanne's new boyfriend, a self-proclaimed genius named Rad Thibodeaux, throw a wild party in Boomhauer's house. Luanne tells on him and gets him removed as Boomhauer's house-sitter, Bobby starts a prank war with Luanne. Bobby replaces Luanne's birth-control pills with sweet tarts, she convinces him that the trick has gotten her pregnant. To teach Bobby about taking responsibility for his actions, Hank and Peggy tell him that he'll have to marry Luanne.

episodes.name: Sleight of Hank
episodes.overview: Hank and Peggy go to a magic show where Peggy gets to be the volunteer in the best trick.  Hank tries to figure out how the trick was done, and Peggy won't tell him.  Meanwhile, Bobby is looking for a way to liven up his Sunday School report on Jesus, and when he sees the magician, he incorporates some of the tricks and patter into the report, calling it "The Amazing Jesus."

episodes.name: Jon Vitti Presents: "Return to La Grunta"
episodes.overview: Hank gets Luanne a job as a golf course drink girl at the La Grunta resort.  In gratitude, Luanne gets Hank a chance to swim with a dolphin. Hank pets the dolphin, and the dolphin becomes aroused and tries to become sexually intimate with him.  In return for his silence, the hotel pays him off, and Hank tells Luanne never to talk about what happened. Luanne gets sexually harassed by one of the golfers, she decides to follow Hank's example and not talk about it.

episodes.name: Escape from Party Island
episodes.overview: Hank takes his mother and her friends to a museum of miniatures in Port Aransas, and they get stuck in the middle of MTV's Spring Break.  Meanwhile, Bill tries to put the moves on Peggy while Hank is away.

episodes.name: Love Hurts... and So Does Art
episodes.overview: Worried at the prospect of going to a school dance with Connie, Bobby starts overeating at the local deli, and develops gout.  Meanwhile, Hank goes to an art gallery in Dallas and finds that they are displaying an X-ray of his constipated colon.

episodes.name: Hankâ€™s Cowboy Movie
episodes.overview: When Hank takes Bobby to the Dallas Cowboys training camp in Wichita Falls, Bobby says he likes Wichita Falls better than Arlen.  Fearing that Bobby will leave Arlen when he grows up, Hank decides to make a video to convince the Cowboys to move their training camp to Arlen.

episodes.name: Dog Dale Afternoon
episodes.overview: When Dale brings home a new 'Super Mower' the neighbors are jealous, but his attitude leaves everyone with a bad taste in their mouths.  To knock him down a few notches, the crew decides to  hide his new mower, & make it look like a conspiracy, Peggy gets involved and it goes too far.  Dale gets pushed over the edge & it is Hank that goes to help him back down.

episodes.name: Revenge of the Lutefisk
episodes.overview: Arlen's new minister is a woman, which everyone except Cotton seems to accept.  When Bobby eats all of a Midwestern fish dish prepared by the minister, it somehow leads to him accidentally burning down the church.  Everyone assumes that Cotton did it, and he is arrested for a hate crime.

episodes.name: Death and Texas
episodes.overview: Peggy gets a letter from a Death Row convict who says that he is a former student of hers, and that she had the most positive impact on his life.  She starts visiting him in prison and bringing him what she thinks is timer sand for Boggle -- not realizing that it's actually cocaine.  Meanwhile, Dale wants to become an executioner.

episodes.name: Wings of the Dope
episodes.overview: While studying for her beauty school exam, Luanne sees someone bouncing on Buckley's old trampoline.  It's Buckley, who has come back as an angel.  Hank and Peggy think Luanne was hallucinating after using too many hair-dying chemicals, but Hank's friends come to believe in the existence of Buckley's Angel.  But Luanne finds that Buckley isn't much more help to her as an angel than he was when he was alive.

episodes.name: Take Me Out of the Ball Game
episodes.overview: When Thaterton stacks his Company softball team with Pro sports stars, Hank pulls Peggy off of her own Softball team to become the Ace pitcher for Strickland Propane. Unfortunately,  Hank's over-managing causes her to lose her stuff, and cause her to lose the love for the sport.

episodes.name: As Old as the Hills
episodes.overview: Peggy and Hank's 20th-anniversary party leaves the missus missing their youth; and a bottle of tequila is the highlight of their private revelry.

episodes.name: Peggy Hill: The Decline and Fall
episodes.overview: Peggy's fate and details surrounding Cotton and Didi's newborn are revealed.

episodes.name: Cotton's Plot
episodes.overview: Freed from a six-week body cast, non-ambulatory Peggy takes physical therapy from Cotton, who drills her military style. Meanwhile, Hank's pals make use of her cast.

episodes.name: Bills Are Made to Be Broken
episodes.overview: Bill is accepting, but Hank isn't, when opposing players lie down to let an injured high-school jock break Bill's touchdown record.

episodes.name: Little Horrors of Shop
episodes.overview: Forced to take a vacation, Hank becomes a substitute shop teacher, and a popular one, rousing jealousy in Peggy.

episodes.name: Aisle 8A
episodes.overview: Hank is the only one home when houseguest Connie has her first encounter with menstruation--and neither knows what to do. Meanwhile, someone has to explain PMS to Bobby.

episodes.name: A Beer Can Named Desire
episodes.overview: Bill meets Cajun relatives and Hank competes for $1 million in a beer promotion at a football game in New Orleans.

episodes.name: Happy Hank's Giving
episodes.overview: Hank's propane-smoked turkey is a casualty in "a war called 'Thanksgiving at the Airport'" as weather stalls the Hills' trip to Peggy's folks in Montana.

episodes.name: Not in My Back-hoe
episodes.overview: Jealous of Hank's new acquaintance, Bill and Dale give Hank an ultimatum, and compound their mistake when they try to make amends.

episodes.name: To Kill a Ladybird
episodes.overview: Bobby's affection for a raccoon brings problems when Hank's dog Ladybird and Dale get into fights with the ersatz pet that could be rabid.

episodes.name: Hillennium
episodes.overview: A propane shortage gives Hank Y2K fears that alter his Christmas-gift plans; Dale's stash of hoarded goods is destroyed by a hamster that he was planning to use for food.

episodes.name: Old Glory
episodes.overview: Bobby keeps mum that his mom wrote the A-plus essay that made him a school star.

episodes.name: Rodeo Days
episodes.overview: Bobby's new calling is rodeo roping, but his first experience with livestock introduces him to an ambition even greater--at least to Bobby.

episodes.name: Hanky Panky
episodes.overview: Hank and Peggy are caught in the middle after Strickland's wife catches him with his girlfriend.

episodes.name: High Anxiety
episodes.overview: Hank becomes the prime suspect in an investigation led by Sheriff Buford.

episodes.name: Naked Ambition
episodes.overview: Bobby's accidental glimpse of a naked Luanne has Joseph yearning to get his own look. But Connie catches them trying to peep, and thinks she's the target.

episodes.name: Movin' On Up
episodes.overview: Luanne moves out and into the house across the alley, where her roommates don't carry any of the load.

episodes.name: Bill of Sales
episodes.overview: Bill becomes Peggy's star--and only--salesman in a health-food sales operation, and his profits net them a trip to a conference in San Antonio, where they must share a room.

episodes.name: Won't You Pimai Neighbor?
episodes.overview: Buddhist monks think Bobby is a reincarnated Lama.

episodes.name: Hank's Bad Hair Day
episodes.overview: After his lifelong barber loses it, Hank turns to Army haircutter Bill, who does a fine job on his first civilian head, but at a Government price, prompting Hank to declare war.

episodes.name: Meet the Propaniacs
episodes.overview: Bobby's impromptu comedy at a propane sale prompts Strickland to send him on the road to entertain at other outlets, leading to a big trade show in front of the Texas propane president.

episodes.name: Nancy Boys
episodes.overview: After joining the Hills for a free romantic dinner, the Gribbles sleep together, and guilt grabs Nancy for cheating on her lover, John Redcorn.

episodes.name: Flush with Power
episodes.overview: Water restrictions prompt Hank to join the zoning board, while Bobby blackmails Kahn for bribing a water-meter reader.

episodes.name: Transnational Amusements Presents: Peggy's Magic Sex Feet
episodes.overview: Peggy's embarrassment about her big feet ends when she meets a fetishist who directs her in a video Hank thinks is dirty, but Peggy approves of--wholefootedly.

episodes.name: Peggy's Fan Fair
episodes.overview: At Nashville's Fan Fair, Peggy accuses Randy Travis of stealing her song, while Brooks & Dunn counsel Bobby about Connie.

episodes.name: The Perils of Polling
episodes.overview: Bobby's act of heroism leads the Hills to a meeting with candidate George Dub-Ya, who turns Hank's vote from sure to tentative with the shake of a hand.

episodes.name: The Buck Stops Here
episodes.overview: Bobby becomes Strickland's personal caddy and picks up some bad habits. Meanwhile, Peggy and Minh compete to donate the most blood.

episodes.name: I Don't Want to Wait...
episodes.overview: As Hank builds coffins for his family, Bobby struggles with the fact that he's still treated as a child even as Joseph laments how awkward adulthood is for him.

episodes.name: Spin the Choice
episodes.overview: Bobby rejects Thanksgiving after history lessons from John Redcorn, who longs to be a real father to his illegitimate son Joseph.

episodes.name: Peggy Makes the Big Leagues
episodes.overview: The Booster Club sends a distraught Hank to talk to Peggy after she fails the football team's star fullback and gets him suspended from the team.

episodes.name: When Cotton Comes Marching Home
episodes.overview: Cash-flow problems plague Hank's father, who's forced to work a menial job on Veterans Day instead of marching in the parade.

episodes.name: What Makes Bobby Run?
episodes.overview: Bobby goes all-out to become school mascot, a high-profile post that suffers a low blow when he avoids a time-honored tradition.

episodes.name: 'Twas the Nut Before Christmas
episodes.overview: Bill counters his holiday loneliness by becoming a generous Santa, attracting a nice single mother and a young slacker who takes advantage.

episodes.name: Chasing Bobby
episodes.overview: Peggy thinks Hank's tears are indicative of a father-son void, but they're really about his truck, which looks headed for pickup-truck heaven.

episodes.name: Yankee Hankie
episodes.overview: While a distraught Hank tries to deal with the fact that he wasn't born in Texas, Cotton and his buddies once again make plans to assassinate Fidel Castro.

episodes.name: Hank and the Great Glass Elevator
episodes.overview: Bill and former Texas governor Ann Richards hit it off after a chance meeting resulting from Hank's reluctant prank in an Austin hotel.

episodes.name: Now Whoâ€™s the Dummy?
episodes.overview: Bobby's ventriloquist's dummy gets more of Hank's attention than Bobby, but it's Dale who harbors a grudge against the wooden being.

episodes.name: Ho Yeah!
episodes.overview: Unaware that the new employee at Strickland Propane is a prostitute, Peggy becomes her best friend and even offers her a place to stay--Hank's den.

episodes.name: The Exterminator
episodes.overview: Repeated exposure to poisons forces Dale out of extermination and into a desk job that leads him back into extermination--of careers.

episodes.name: Luanne Virgin 2.0
episodes.overview: As Luanne's sponsor in a sexual-abstinence program, Peggy has to testify about her lifetime total of sexual partners--and it's more than one.

episodes.name: Hank's Choice
episodes.overview: When Bobby develops an allergy to Ladybird, Hank builds a doghouse, an elaborate accommodation that's perfect--for Bobby.

episodes.name: It's Not Easy Being Green
episodes.overview: Hank joins Bobby's environmental effort, but only to preserve a long-time cover-up concerning a mishap with Boomhauer's car in high school.

episodes.name: The Trouble with Gribbles
episodes.overview: Dale plans to buy Nancy a face-lift by suing a tobacco company, which countersues--and carelessly bugs his home.

episodes.name: Hank's Back Story
episodes.overview: Wearing a prosthetic rump relieves Hank's back pain, but makes him the butt of friends' jokes as they all prepare for a riding-mower race.

episodes.name: Kidney Boy and Hamster Girl: A Love Story
episodes.overview: Bobby avoids a beating by high schoolers by pretending to be one of them.

episodes.name: Bobby Goes Nuts
episodes.overview: Bobby goes from bullied to bully after learning a counterattack move in a self-defense class--for women.

episodes.name: Soldier of Misfortune
episodes.overview: After an accident at his gun club destroys Dale's confidence, Peggy proposes sending him on a bogus mercenary mission, which he fouls up.

episodes.name: Lupe's Revenge
episodes.overview: A female cop gets a hankerin' for Hank; Peggy accidentally brings back a native child after a school field trip to Mexico.

episodes.name: The Father, the Son, and J.C.
episodes.overview: Hank's emotional outburst pushes him further from his father, so Bobby drafts Jimmy Carter to broker a Christmas peace.

episodes.name: Father of the Bribe
episodes.overview: After Bobby feigns taking Connie's father's bribe to break up with her, Connie lets her grades slip to show how upset she is without him.

episodes.name: I'm with Cupid
episodes.overview: Bobby adjusts to his breakup with Connie, until Bill's depressing experiences break his spirit. So Hank sends him to ladies' man Boomhauer.

episodes.name: Torch Song Hillogy
episodes.overview: Peggy nominates Bobby to carry the Olympic torch through Arlen, but it's Hank who wins the honor--and bungles it.

episodes.name: Joust Like a Woman
episodes.overview: Peggy leads a troupe of "wenches" to protest their unfair treatment at the Renaissance Faire, where Hank is trying to land a big-money propane account.

episodes.name: The Bluegrass is Always Greener
episodes.overview: Hank and the boys recruit Connie for a bluegrass fiddle contest, but Kahn insists that she focus on classical music.

episodes.name: The Substitute Spanish Prisoner
episodes.overview: A con man offers "genius" Peggy an at-home doctorate course, which she finances with the Hills' retirement fund.

episodes.name: Unfortunate Son
episodes.overview: Cotton's financially strapped VFW group moves into Hank's home, prompting Hank to recruit Vietnam vets, to whom Cotton doesn't exactly cotton.

episodes.name: Are You There God?  It's Me, Margaret Hill
episodes.overview: Unable to find a full-time teaching job, Peggy pretends to be a nun to land a position at a Catholic school, ending her budding career at Strickland Propane.

episodes.name: Tankin' It to the Streets
episodes.overview: After learning the Army used him as a guinea pig for an experimental drug, Bill gets drunk and steals a tank. And it's up to his friends to try to return it.

episodes.name: Of Mice and Little Green Men
episodes.overview: When Hank and Dale find more interest in the activities of the other's son, Dale concludes he's not Joseph's father--and that an alien is.

episodes.name: A Man Without a Country Club
episodes.overview: Kahn covets membership in an all-Asian country club, but it's Hank who's asked to join--as a token white to secure a PGA tournament.

episodes.name: Beer and Loathing
episodes.overview: Peggy gets a job at Alamo Beer, but a clause in her contract prevents her from telling Hank why Texas is completely devoid of the brew for the next 36 hours.

episodes.name: Fun with Jane and Jane
episodes.overview: Oblivious to its cultlike ways, Luanne joins a sorority and gets Peggy in too; Hank and the boys rescue emus from death, but don't know what to do with them.

episodes.name: My Own Private Rodeo
episodes.overview: Hank learns that the incident estranging Dale from his cowboy father was a cover to keep him in the dark about Dad being in the closet.

episodes.name: Sug Night
episodes.overview: Hank is shaken after having a dream about grilling burgers...naked...with Nancy. And the situation is stirred when Peggy finds out.

episodes.name: Dang Ol' Love
episodes.overview: Bill is heartbroken when the beautiful jogger he's pining for falls for Boomhauer, who is in turn heartbroken himself when the jogger dumps him.

episodes.name: Returning Japanese (1)
episodes.overview: The Hills are off to Japan so Cotton can apologize to the widow of a soldier he killed in WWII, but something about Cotton's story doesn't quite add up.

episodes.name: Returning Japanese (2)
episodes.overview: Cotton runs amuck in Tokyo when rejected by his newly found Japanese son.

episodes.name: Get Your Freak Off
episodes.overview: Bobby meets a new girl, but Hank objects to her parents' liberal parenting style.

episodes.name: The Fat and the Furious
episodes.overview: A competitive eating groupie encourages Bill to enter a hot dog eating contest.

episodes.name: Bad Girls, Bad Girls, Whatcha Gonna Do
episodes.overview: Connie's delinquent cousin captivates Bobby, who's oblivious when she turns their science project into a drug lab.

episodes.name: Goodbye Normal Jeans
episodes.overview: Hank is opposed to Bobby's taking Home Economics, until his domestic skills outshine those of Peggy, who tries to sabotage his Thanksgiving meal.

episodes.name: Dances with Dogs
episodes.overview: A dog-dancing contest pits Hank and Ladybird against Bobby and Connie's dog, while Bill tries to partner with a rottweiler.

episodes.name: The Son Also Roses
episodes.overview: Bobby's preference for gardening over gridiron irks Hank, until he enters Bobby in a rose-growing contest.

episodes.name: The Texas Skillsaw Massacre
episodes.overview: Hank is ordered to take an anger-management class after accidentally cutting one of Dale's fingers off. Dale claims it was retaliation for his causing Hank's kitchen floor to collapse.

episodes.name: Full Metal Dust Jacket
episodes.overview: Seeking an invitation to a book club, Peggy takes over the lease for a bookstore, where business is a bust--until she lets Dale sell guns there, too.

episodes.name: Pigmalion
episodes.overview: A local pork producer is impressed by Luanne, who goes to his home for a job interview but comes away as his girlfriend.

episodes.name: Megalo Dale
episodes.overview: Dale exterminates at the Mega Lo Mart, thanks to an endorsement from a reluctant Hank.

episodes.name: Boxing Luanne
episodes.overview: Luanne becomes a boxer and, buoyed by success in fixed fights, challenges George Foreman's daughter.

episodes.name: Vision Quest
episodes.overview: Worried about how Dale is raising Joseph, John Redcorn asks Hank to take the boy he fathered on a Native American rite of passage.

episodes.name: Queasy Rider
episodes.overview: Hank and Peggy find marital salvation in a motorcycle--until their first long trip.

episodes.name: Board Games
episodes.overview: Peggy, Minh and Nancy bond to save a school program, but split up when Minh decides she's the best candidate for a school-board seat.

episodes.name: An Officer and a Gentle Boy
episodes.overview: To toughen up Bobby, Hank decides to send him to Cotton's old boot camp, unaware that lawsuits have altered the severe conditions.

episodes.name: The Miseducation of Bobby Hill
episodes.overview: Despite a lack of seasoning that Hank deems mandatory, Bobby becomes a whiz at selling propane grills; Bill takes an inadvertent balloon ride.

episodes.name: The Good Buck
episodes.overview: Kicked out by his wife, Hank's hard-living boss, Buck, turns to religion, assisted by his personal Bible coach: Luanne.

episodes.name: I Never Promised You an Organic Garden
episodes.overview: Peggy takes over the organic garden at Bobby's school, but an insect infestation threatens her hope of making the post permanent.

episodes.name: Be True to Your Fool
episodes.overview: After inadvertently spreading lice to his buddies, a shunned and depressed Bill winds up in jail, where his popularity soars.

episodes.name: Racist Dawg
episodes.overview: A handyman sees racism in a bite from Ladybird, suspected of picking up subconscious cues from her master, Hank.

episodes.name: Night and Deity
episodes.overview: A pest-control expert's chemistry with Dale worries Nancy; Hank is the designated driver as Luanne turns 21.

episodes.name: Maid in Arlen
episodes.overview: To escape her daughter-in-law, Kahn's mother does maid work for the Hills, and for Bill, who finds the woman romantically made-to-order.

episodes.name: The Witches of East Arlen
episodes.overview: Reading tarot cards introduces Bobby to a coven of compatriots who want to train him to become a wizard.

episodes.name: Patch Boomhauer
episodes.overview: When Boomhauer's brother, Patch, announces he's getting married to Boomhauer's old girlfriend, Hank mistakenly comes to believe that Boomhauer is out to sabotage the wedding.

episodes.name: Reborn to Be Wild
episodes.overview: Hank likes Bobby's new Christian youth group, but not their methods of worship, which include skateboarding and punk rock.

episodes.name: New Cowboy on the Block
episodes.overview: The thrill of an ex-Dallas Cowboy moving onto the block is lost on Hank when the one-time hero breaks neighborhood rules.

episodes.name: The Incredible Hank
episodes.overview: Peggy overdoes it when she secretly slips Hank a testosterone supplement to combat his work-related stress. But he feels great, until he finds out.

episodes.name: Flirting with the Master
episodes.overview: A Latin TV star hires Peggy to come to his home in Mexico to tutor his kids, but Peggy senses his interest is not entirely academic.

episodes.name: After the Mold Rush
episodes.overview: The Hills' house tests positive for mold, found again and again just after Hank enters the home in a local showcase.

episodes.name: Livin' on Reds, Vitamin C and Propane
episodes.overview: Hank and Bobby take an 18-wheeler to Arizona, with Dale, Bill and Boomhauer as stowaways.

episodes.name: Rich Hank, Poor Hank
episodes.overview: Hank's thriftiness and reluctance to talk about money leads Bobby to believe he's wealthy, a rumor that spreads through the neighborhood.

episodes.name: Ceci N'Est Pas Une King of the Hill
episodes.overview: Peggy's entry into the art world is rejected at first, then applauded by a dealer whose promotional method leaves her drawn.

episodes.name: That's What She Said
episodes.overview: A new Strickland employee's constant double entendres delight all but Hank, who considers suing for sexual harassment.

episodes.name: My Hair Lady
episodes.overview: Arlen's hottest new haircutting team is Luanne and Bill, who charms the ladies by pretending to be gay.

episodes.name: Phish and Wildlife
episodes.overview: The boys' annual camping trip is disturbed by a gathering of hippies, who share their food with Bobby and expect sharing in return.

guest_stars.character: Stoned Hippie Chick / Teen Girl Hippie (voice)
guest_stars.name: Anna Faris

episodes.name: Cheer Factor
episodes.overview: Peggy's aggressive approach as cheerleading coach brings football wins, and a hearing when one routine is deemed offensive.

episodes.name: Dale Be Not Proud
episodes.overview: Dale donates a kidney to Funny Car racer John Force, and makes Hank his representative in all matters while laid up.

episodes.name: AprÃ¨s Hank, le Deluge
episodes.overview: During a flood, Hank's position as emergency-shelter team leader is usurped by Bill when Hank is drafted to watch over a fragile dam.

episodes.name: DaleTech
episodes.overview: Hank's father becomes part of a civilian police patrol, usurping Dale's self-proclaimed title of neighborhood protector.

episodes.name: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Alamo
episodes.overview: Ignorance of the Alamo in Bobby's Texas History class prompts Hank to help organize a reenactment, but the author's version is revisionist.

guest_stars.character: Bruce Tuttle / Davy Crockett / Gerald Charping (voice)
guest_stars.name: David Herman

episodes.name: Girl, You'll Be a Giant Soon
episodes.overview: Luanne helps Hank protest a grilling competition that bans propane; Peggy negotiates to see an infamous murder site.

episodes.name: Stressed for Success
episodes.overview: Bobby joins his school academic team as the expert in pop culture, but the pressure gets to him.

episodes.name: Hank's Back
episodes.overview: Hank starts taking yoga classes after injuring his back at work; Peggy bags groceries at a mom and pop store that's having a hard time competing against Megalomart.

episodes.name: The Redneck on Rainey Street
episodes.overview: After Connie becomes a victim of reverse discrimination, Kahn gives up his hopes and dreams and embraces the life of a hillbilly.

episodes.name: Talking Shop
episodes.overview: Bobby becomes a peer counselor, but gets personally involved with clients.

episodes.name: A Rover Runs Through It
episodes.overview: Peggy's estranged mother summons her home to their Montana ranch, where Henry Winkler is an uncooperative neighbor.

episodes.name: Ms. Wakefield
episodes.overview: An elderly woman who once lived in the Hills' house returns for the holidays--to die there. And that gives Dale a business idea.

episodes.name: Death Buys a Timeshare
episodes.overview: Hank accompanies Cotton and his new friend Bill to Mexico to try to keep them from buying timeshare properties. But the salesmen are determined.

episodes.name: Yard, She Blows!
episodes.overview: Hank's immaculately manicured front lawn is as good as gone when Peggy tries to horn in on the glory with her own contributions.

episodes.name: Dale to the Chief
episodes.overview: Hank's fight to correct an error on his driver's license is a red flag to newly patriotic Dale, who reports Hank as a threat to national security.

episodes.name: The Petriot Act
episodes.overview: Hank excitedly joins a new military program that allows civilians to adopt pets while G.I.s serve their tour of duty but the dog, Duke, turns out to be a mean-spirited cat.

episodes.name: Enrique-cilable Differences
episodes.overview: Hank cringes when an employee with personal problems turns to him for solace.

episodes.name: Mutual of Omabwah
episodes.overview: Hank's lapsed insurance policy puts him in an overprotective state, while Bill and Boomhauer carelessly experiment with deep-frying.

episodes.name: Care-Takinâ€™ Care of Business
episodes.overview: Covert work by Hank and the boys turns a befuddled groundskeeper into a hero when his field is credited with hampering opponents.

episodes.name: Arlen City Bomber
episodes.overview: Peggy follows Luanne onto a roller-derby team, where the tight-fisted owner prompts her to lead a revolt and form a team on borrowed money.

episodes.name: Redcorn Gambles with His Future
episodes.overview: John Redcorn tries to open a Native American gambling casino to provide a venue for his band, Big Mountain Fudgecake.

episodes.name: Smoking and the Bandit
episodes.overview: Dale dons a disguise to defy Arlen's smoking ban, and Peggy sets out to uncover his identity.

guest_stars.character: Bartender / Math Teacher / Really Old Bartender (voice)
guest_stars.name: David Herman

episodes.name: Gone with the Windstorm
episodes.overview: Peggy helps weather-girl Nancy fight back when she's replaced by a qualified meteorologist. Also, a boy barking like a dog scares Bobby.

guest_stars.character: Tom Chick / TV Announcer / Fireman Gennaro (voice)
guest_stars.name: Phil Hendrie

episodes.name: Bobby on Track
episodes.overview: Hank talks Bobby into joining the track team, but the spot the boy lands isn't what Hank had in mind.

episodes.name: It Ainâ€™t Over â€™til the Fat Neighbor Sings
episodes.overview: Bill finds happiness in a men's chorus, where the required devotion jeopardizes his Army career.

episodes.name: Hank's on Board
episodes.overview: Hank discovers that Dale and Boomhauer take yearly vacations together, and assumes that they are trying to avoid Bill.  He invites his family and Bill along for a weekend at the beach, but during the trip, Hank realizes that his friends are actually trying to avoid him because heâ€™s uptight and bossy. Peggy advises Hank to throw caution to the wind and have some fun with his buddies, but the results leave Hank and the guys overboard.

episodes.name: Bystand Me
episodes.overview: When the Arlen Bystander gets a new editor, Peggy gets a job writing a household hints column.  Except Peggy doesn't know any household hints, so she gets Minh to supply her with housekeeping tips in exchange for the answers to the New York Times crossword puzzles.  Meanwhile, Hank makes Bobby get a paper route.

guest_stars.character: Burl Arlington / Harv Judd / Roddy Rae Biffel (voice)
guest_stars.name: Phil Hendrie

episodes.name: Billâ€™s House
episodes.overview: After Bill nurses Hank, Peggy and Bobby through the flu, he starts to feel lonely when there is no one else to take care of.  Hank gets Bill to volunteer at a halfway house for alcoholics, and Bill invites the residents to stay with him. As more and more houseguests show up, Hank becomes determined to find them a permanent residence. Meanwhile, Peggy makes a promise to God that if she gets over the flu, she'll learn to ride a bike, and Bobby makes her keep her promise.

episodes.name: Harlottown
episodes.overview: When Hank and Peggy try to clean up a historic Arlen landmark, they find out that the town was founded by harlots and was once a place of ill-repute. The new city manager uses the city's rediscovered history to turn the town into a tourist trap for the adult porn industry. Frustrated by the changes, Hank decides to move the family â€“ that is, until he is aided by adult actress Candee.

episodes.name: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Clown
episodes.overview: Hoping to get Bobby to stop cracking jokes in school, Hank enrolls Bobby in a clown class at the local community college.  The pretentious instructor teaches Bobby classical comedic theory and sucks all the fun out of him.

episodes.name: Orange You Sad I Did Say Banana?
episodes.overview: Kahn is accused of having become so assimilated that he's a "banana" -- the Asian equivalent of an "Oreo."  To get back to his Laotian heritage, Kahn adopts a simple lifestyle and abandons the swimming pool his neighbors helped build.

episodes.name: You Gotta Believe (In Moderation)
episodes.overview: In order to raise money to save the Tom Landry Middle School baseball program, Hank invites a Harlem Globetrotters-type softball team to compete against his community league Arlen Zephyrs.  But Hank ruins the show by deciding to take the game seriously.

episodes.name: Business is Picking Up
episodes.overview: When Bobby attends the school's job shadow program, he winds up interning for Peter Sterling, a man who runs a pooper-scooper business. Bobby is so impressed by Peter that he decides to pursue the same career.  Meanwhile, Hank is trying to train Joseph at Strickland Propane.

episodes.name: The Year of Washing Dangerously
episodes.overview: Hank gets sucked into Kahn's get-rich-quick scheme when Kahn buys the car wash that hosts car cruising on Friday nights. But Kahn wrecks the business by trying to cut corners, and gets bought out by Buck Strickland. Meanwhile, Peggy tries to figure out if Nancy is deliberately refusing to take her calls.

episodes.name: Hank Fixes Everything
episodes.overview: Buck Strickland embarks on a propane price war with Thatherton and two other rivals, and hires the guys from "American Chopper" to boost sales at the Propane Expo.  When the 'war' goes too far, and the companies are all losing profit, Hank takes matters into his own hands, and calls a meeting.  Unfortunately, the owners decide to 'price fix' and get caught.  Meanwhile, Lucky and Luanne wait for Brownville Station tickets, in line 6 days before tickets go on sale.

episodes.name: Church Hopping
episodes.overview: When Reverend Stroup gives the Hills' pew at the Arlen First Methodist Church to another family, Hank and his family decide to find another church. A slick pastor tries to bribe the Hills into worshipping at his Megachurch.

episodes.name: 24 Hour Propane People
episodes.overview: When Buck gets banned from his favorite strip club, he refocuses on making Strickland Propane a "fun" place to work. He makes his employees dress in costumes, have sleepovers in the office and use hip catchphrases. It's up to Hank to get everyone focused on selling propane again.

episodes.name: The Texas Panhandler
episodes.overview: Instead of getting a job, Bobby and Joseph discover that they can make more money, and look cooler, by hanging out on street corners and begging.

episodes.name: Hank's Bully
episodes.overview: A young boy, Caleb, starts following Hank around, making fun of him and generally annoying him.  Hank isn't sure how to deal with such a young bully.

episodes.name: Edu-macating Lucky
episodes.overview: Lucky asks Peggy to help him get his GED in the hopes of improving his chances of marrying Luanne.  Peggy intentionally teaches him the wrong information so he'll fail and give up the idea of marrying her niece, but then she starts to suspect that Luanne might be pregnant.

episodes.name: The Peggy Horror Picture Show
episodes.overview: Feeling unfeminine after a clothing exchange party with the neighborhood girls, Hank offers Peggy a new pair of shoes. After finding that her usual place in Lubbock is out of business, she stumbles upon 'Clairissa's Closet', and a new best friend, Carolyn. They become the best of friends, until Peggy finds out that Carolyn is a he, and Carolyn finds that Peggy is a she.

episodes.name: SerPUNt
episodes.overview: When Bobby's snakes gets into the toilet Hank decides to call Animal Control. But instead of taking care of the problem they make the city believe that the problem is worse than it is causing panic. Now it is up to Dale to save the city.

episodes.name: Blood and Sauce
episodes.overview: The guys discuss what they want to pass on to their children, Bill becomes despondent because he doesnâ€™t have any. In an effort to cheer him up, they help Bill put together a Dauterive family reunion, only to be thwarted by the realization that Bill only has one living relative. Bill winds up sharing an incredible barbeque with his neighbors and teaches Bobby the secret sauce recipe.

episodes.name: Luanne Gets Lucky
episodes.overview: When Lucky ditches Luanne to go stumping with Hank and the gang, Luanne accepts an invitation to attend Arlen High School's Senior Prom. Lucky's friends Mud Dobber and Elvin take it upon themeselves bully Luanne's 15-year-old date.

episodes.name: Hank Gets Dusted
episodes.overview: Hank is crestfallen when Cotton gives his beloved Cadillac to Cousin Dusty, however things get even worse when Dusty shows up at Hank's house with a reality TV show crew.

episodes.name: Glen Peggy Glen Ross
episodes.overview: Peggy loses her job at The Arlen Bystander and begins a new career as a real estate agent. Meanwhile, after Dale buys a set of titanium golf clubs at a police auction, he gives the clubs to Hank.  However, Hank has trouble playing with a set of clubs that once belonged to a convicted murderer.

guest_stars.character: Burl Arlington / Harv Judd / Roddy Rae Biffel (voice)
guest_stars.name: Phil Hendrie

episodes.name: The Passion of Dauterive
episodes.overview: After Bill survives a roof cave-in over his bed he has a religious experience which involves a romantic liaison with Reverend Stroup.

episodes.name: Grand Theft Arlen
episodes.overview: Hank becomes obsessed with a video game about propane.  Meanwhile, Bobby trains for the Presidential Fitness Test.

episodes.name: Peggyâ€™s Gone to Pots
episodes.overview: Peggy tries to reach the pinnacle of real estate success by selling houses in the exclusive neighborhood of Arlen Heights, but she winds up selling pots door to door. Meanwhile the real Rusty Shackleford pays a visit to Dale.

episodes.name: Hair Today, Gone Today
episodes.overview: Nancy turns to her mother for help when the stress of home life and unresolved feelings for Redcorn cause her hair to fall out.

episodes.name: Bill, Bulk and the Body Buddies
episodes.overview: Bill has to shape up for an upcoming Army physical, but when he becomes friends with a group of body builders he becomes aggressive and develops a bad attitude.  Hank and the gang have to come to the rescue.

episodes.name: Lucky's Wedding Suit
episodes.overview: Season finale. When Lucky wants to give Luanne the expensive wedding that she desires, he sues Dale with a frivolous lawsuit after having an accident on the job.  After Lucky's lawyer finds out that Dale does not have insurance, he goes after Strickland Propane.

episodes.name: Suite Smells of Excess
episodes.overview: When the guys take Bobby to a college football game, their hijinks land them in a VIP box suite and calling plays for the visiting team.

episodes.name: Bobby Rae
episodes.overview: To impress a girl, Bobby protests against soda machines in the school.  However, since the teachers have been using the drink machine money to pay for their "retreat", they decide to fight back. Meanwhile, Dale decides to record his friends' witty quotes and put them all in a book.

episodes.name: The Powder Puff Boys
episodes.overview: Hank encourages Bobby when he is asked to cheerleader for the girls in the school's annual Powder Puff game.  Bobby soon learns that there is a tradition and Hank, Bill, Dale and Principal Moss were once "Powder Puff Boys" themselves. However, the boys learn that Peggy and the PTA Are trying to put a stop to the tradition.

episodes.name: Four Wave Intersection
episodes.overview: Arlen is hit by a heat wave and Hank and the gang take the kids to the water park. Unfortunately, when they have to tangle with a group of surfer bullies, Boomhauer, who is usually cool, winds up embarrassing himself. Meanwhile, Bill becomes known as the famous "Heat-Waver" when he begins to stand on the side of the highway and wave to motorists.

episodes.name: Death Picks Cotton
episodes.overview: When the family goes out to a restaurant where the food is cooked at the table Cotton throws a tantrum and gets into a fight with the chef.  The fight leaves Cotton near death in the hospital.

episodes.name: Raise the Steaks
episodes.overview: After Hank falls in love with organic food he starts his own mini co-op garden in his back yard.

episodes.name: Tears of an Inflatable Clown
episodes.overview: Bobby gets mixed up with racial intolerance at Tom Landry Junior High.  Meanwhile, Lucky hurts himself by catching a frisbee made of barbed wire and the gang has to convince him to go to the hospital.

episodes.name: The Minh Who Knew Too Much
episodes.overview: Mihn joins the Arlen Gun Club so that she can practise her skeet-shooting skills and become a member of the Nine Rivers Country Club team.  However, Minh loses track of the goal when she starts to identify with her "hillbilly" neighbors.

episodes.name: Dream Weaver
episodes.overview: After they have financial troubles, Nancy convinces Dale to go on a "vocation vacation" to learn a new career.  Unfortunately, Dale picks basket-weaving, and he's not very good at it. Meanwhile, Peggy, Bill and Kahn try to create the next great Internet video.

episodes.name: Doggone Crazy
episodes.overview: Ladybird is put on a list of vicious dogs after she gets a little crazy and bites Hank.  Afterwards, Hank is urged by a veterinarian to take Ladybird to a "dog spiritualist".

episodes.name: Trans-Fascism
episodes.overview: Hank helps Buck Strickland battle the Arlen City Council and a rival restaurant after "Sugarfoots" loses its business due to a local ban on the sale of foods containing trans fats.

episodes.name: Untitled Blake McCormick Project
episodes.overview: Bill falls in love after he has a blind date with Charlene, a hot single mother. However, Dale's intuition tells him  something is not quite right with the whole situation.

episodes.name: The Accidental Terrorist
episodes.overview: Hank buys Peggy a new car, and like he has always done he pays sticker price for it.  However, after he realizes that he has been ripped off for years, he plots revenge against the car salesman.

episodes.name: Lady and Gentrification
episodes.overview: Hank's agrees to speak at Enrique's daughter's quinceaeara (15th birthday party).  However, some of Peggy's real-estate clients fall in love with the quaint Mexican neighborhood and start to move in.

episodes.name: Behind Closed Doors
episodes.overview: Peggy becomes over-protective after a child goes missing in Arlen.

episodes.name: Pour Some Sugar on Kahn
episodes.overview: Kahn escapes to the bar and takes up Karaoke after Minh's father comes to visit. Meanwhile, Bobby and Peggy compete in an escalating game where they try to outdo each other.

episodes.name: Six Characters in Search of a House
episodes.overview: Peggy has trouble selling a house when she realizes that the current residents are scaring away the buyers, so she hires actors to play their parts.

episodes.name: The Courtship of Joseph's Father
episodes.overview: Dale's son becomes the star quarterback for Landry High School, but Dale pushes the boy to accept a private school's offer, which includes a cash contract.

episodes.name: Strangeness on a Train
episodes.overview: Stressed that her birthday parties never live up to her expectations, Peggy plans herself a disco-themed party on a mystery train, but after Luanne ruins the surprise, Peggy worries her parties will always end badly. However, a new mystery arises after a couple sneaks away for some private time in the train bathroom, and the partygoers must figure out who did it.

episodes.name: Cops and Robert
episodes.overview: Bobby has to work as a deputy for the school's police officer after he is framed for throwing a soda can.  Meanwhile, Hank accidentally takes the wallet of a man he thought stole his own wallet, however when he tries to return the wallet the man does not take it too well.

guest_stars.character: Bazooms Manager / Dealer #1 / Man on TV (voice)
guest_stars.name: David Herman

episodes.name: It Came from the Garage
episodes.overview: Wanting to spend some quality time with his son, Hank distracts Dale, Bill and Boomhauer with a boat building competition. However, when bats attack the construction garage, Hank has to give up his idea of spending time with Bobby.

episodes.name: Life: A Loser's Manual
episodes.overview: Luanne's long-lost father and Peggy's brother Hoyt, a two-strike felon, comes to Arlen. After Hoyt gets caught committing another crime, Lucky feels bad and takes the blame, leaving Hoyt free to continue his life of crime.

episodes.name: Dia-BILL-ic Shock
episodes.overview: Bill's love of sugary snacks causes diabetes. After a doctor tells Bill that he will lose his legs he decides to start using a wheelchair. Once he is wheelchair bound he finds camaraderie with Thunder, a wheelchair sports enthusiast. Things turn around for Bill until Thunder finds out that Bill does not really need the wheelchair.

episodes.name: Earthy Girls Are Easy
episodes.overview: When a local paper plans to run a story about Strickland Propane dumping old propane tanks into the river, Hank suggests that the company go green. Dale, in an attempt to impress the ladies, organizes an Earth benefit concert.

episodes.name: Square-Footed Monster
episodes.overview: Hank and the guys do a good deed when they fix-up a neighborhood house, however after Ted Wassonasong buys the house he decides to knock down the house and build a mansion.

episodes.name: Lost in MySpace
episodes.overview: Hank has bad feelings when Mr. Strickland decides to create a MySpace page for Strickland Propane. Hank's fears come true when Donna posts personal videos and information to the web site.

episodes.name: No Bobby Left Behind
episodes.overview: In order to raise the school's average for standardized tests, Principal Moss classifies Bobby as a low achievement student. However, the plan backfires after Bobby is placed in a class where he no longer has to do homework and doesn't have to take the tests.

episodes.name: A Bill Full of Dollars
episodes.overview: Peggy, Minh and Dale play the stock market together, however they lose money in their initial investment. To improve their odds they decide to study the consumer habits of an "average man" and Bill becomes the subject of their study. Meanwhile, after Peggy buys the family a new flat screen TV, Hank and Bobby have difficulty figuring out all the advanced features.

episodes.name: Straight as an Arrow
episodes.overview: Hank tries to help Bobby become a member of the Order of the Straight Arrow, but he disagrees with the "Arrowmaster" who is a new member of Arlen. Meanwhile, Peggy gets involved in the disagreement as she is the local Welcome Wagon representative.

episodes.name: Lucky See, Monkey Do
episodes.overview: Lucky's sister Myrna and her children attend a baby shower in which Peggy is throwing for Luanne. It doesn't take long before Myrna and Peggy clash over how the children will be raised by Luanne, with Peggy wanting the good, old fashioned skills where as Myrna likes the more modern way and by the book.

episodes.name: What Happens at the National Propane Gas Convention in Memphis Stays at the National Propane Gas Convention in Memphis
episodes.overview: The Propane Hall of Fame is inducting Buck Strickland this year and he has asked Hank to come with him to make sure he stays out of trouble. This becomes a hard task after Buck meets his illegitimate son while at the event in Memphis.

episodes.name: Master of Puppets
episodes.overview: Bobby is left waiting at the mall when Hank and Peggy's date goes long. Feeling his parents' guilt, Bobby uses the incident to pit each against one another to show him their affection. Soon, Peggy and Hank stop giving him anything Bobby wants and he demands they spend more time with him.

episodes.name: Bwah My Nose
episodes.overview: Hank and the gang get a rematch for the high-school championship game they lost, when Bill accidentally breaks Hank's nose during a practice. He gets it fixed by a plastic surgeon and loves his new noseâ€”maybe too much.

episodes.name: Uncool Customer
episodes.overview: After Peggy finds out that she is not cool she befriends one of Arlen's most glamorous and cool moms in an effort to learn how to be cool. Bobby befriends her daughter, a girl named Michael Savage.

episodes.name: Nancy Does Dallas
episodes.overview: After Nancy takes a glamorous new job in Dallas and temporarily leaving Dale behind he finds the freedom of the bachelor life too hard to handle.

episodes.name: Born Again on the Fourth of July
episodes.overview: Bobby is offered an intervention at the church, after Hank becomes upset by his misbehavior. Meanwhile, Hank and his pals challenge a rival neighborhood to a Fourth of July fireworks showdown

episodes.name: Serves Me Right For Giving General George S. Patton The Bathroom Key
episodes.overview: Hank discovers that his father's last requests are a collection of bizarre tasks including the wish to have his ashes flushed down a toilet that General George S. Patton once used. Meanwhile, Bill and Dale bicker over an empty beer can.

episodes.name: Bad News Bill
episodes.overview: Hank is troubled when Bobby's Little League Coach is hassling Bobby about his lack of ability until Hank realizes that the Coach is only trying to make Bobby a better player.

episodes.name: Manger Baby Einstein
episodes.overview: Luanne tries to become a breakout star in the children's entertainment industry.

episodes.name: Uh-Oh Canada
episodes.overview: After Boomhauer trades houses with a Canadian family for the summer the Arlen gang tries to make some new neighbors at feel welcome. However it soon becomes apparent that Canadians and Arlenites do not see eye to eye.

episodes.name: The Boy Can't Help It
episodes.overview: Bobby becomes quite the ladies' man when several girls in his class consider him a potential date for the Homecoming dance, but Hank is worried that Bobby is being used.

episodes.name: To Sirloin with Love
episodes.overview: Thankful to finally have something in common with his son, Hank is proud when Bobbyâ€™s knowledge of beef earns him a spot on a college team bound for the State Championships.
